intro: Cacalia tabularis, commonly known as the flatweed or broadleaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming a flat, disk-like structure surrounded by pale green bracts. Cacalia tabularis is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
